messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Sure— I can help with that. Which upcoming reminder would you like to remove? Please let me know the reminder’s content, scheduled time, or its ID so I can find and delete it.
I don't have any more information on it.
I can help by showing you a list of your upcoming reminders so you can pick which one to remove. Would you like me to list them?

messages.name: search_reminder
messages.content: ValueError: No search criteria are given. At least one search criteria should be provided among ('reminder_id', 'content', 'creation_timestamp', 'creation_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'reminder_timestamp', 'latitude', 'longitude')

I can’t fetch “all future” reminders without a time range—my search needs at least a reminder‐timestamp lower or upper bound.  

Could you tell me the time span you’d like to see? For example:  
• Start from “now” (just give me the current date/time) up to a specific end date/time  
• Or say “next week,” “next month,” etc., and I can convert that for you.  

Let me know what period of upcoming reminders you’d like to list.
I don't know. Can you just try with whatever you can?

To pull up your upcoming reminders I need at least one time‐based filter (e.g. “from now until X” or “between A and B”). Could you let me know:

• A “start” date/time (for example, today at 3:00 PM)––that’ll serve as the lower bound  
• And, if you like, an “end” date/time (for example, one week from now)  

If you’re not sure of the exact time, an approximate will work (“this afternoon,” “over the next week,” etc.), and I’ll convert it for you.
